thread.title: Patriots lead Steelers, 3-0, early in AFC championship
thread.title_full: Patriots lead Steelers, 3-0, early in AFC championship

author: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Patriots lead Steelers, 3-0, early in AFC championship
text:
Patriots lead Steelers, 3-0, early in AFC championship January 22, 2017 6:44 PM Steve Mellon/Post-Gazette Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger takes the field at Gillette Stadium to warm up before the start of the AFC championship Sunday in Foxborough, Mass. Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
The Patriots took a 3-0 lead over the Steelers on the first drive of the AFC championsh ipat Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Mass.. 
New England quarterback Tom Brady completed his first four passes before a third down incompletion brought out the field-goal unit. 
The winner will advance to Super Bowl LI, to be played Feb. 5 in Houston. 
Steelers linebacker James Harrison, who endured a triceps injury this week, is active for the game. James Harrison is ACTIVE for the AFC championship, @rayfitt1 reports. https://t.co/9nd3OaPjsB pic.twitter.com/Yeu9T3qjgn â€” Post-Gazette Sports (@PGSportsNow) January 22, 2017 
The Steelers and Patriots are both looking to set an NFL record by advancing to a record ninth Super Bowl.
